async_info.video_title: Dutch family 'waiting for end of time' found in secret room - BBC News
async_info.video_description:
A family who spent nine years on a farm "waiting for the end of time" have been discovered by police in the Netherlands after one of them turned up at a local pub, reports say.
A man of 58 and six young adults aged 18 to 25 were living at a farm in the province of Drenthe.
The family were found after the eldest of the children ordered beer at a bar in the nearby village of Ruinerwold.
He then told staff he needed help, broadcaster RTV Drenthe reported.
"We found six people living in a small space in the house which could be locked but wasn't a basement," police said in a statement late on Tuesday.
The older man has been arrested. According to the family, he is the father of the six children, say police. It was not clear whether they had been there voluntarily, police added. The eldest son was not there at the time, police told the BBC.

comment_content.original_script: So, is this how much individualistic Western societies are? That they don't even know or care about their neighbour at all! This is very strange and quite unpleasant, actually. I don't understand why would people not want to meet with their neighbours or at least know who their neighbours are. People always need people. You never know what for and whom you might need in the future. Neighbours can be your friends who will talk to you, help you as much as they can for anything you might need, and support and come through for you at times. We humans are social creatures, so we need to support and take care of one another in order to form a well-grounded society, to make sure everyone is safe and doing well, to feel the peace and the happiness coming from the power of company. All you care and talk about is "I" and "me" but never anyone else. This is not how a society works. It is all about egocentricism and hyper-individualism which eventually makes you so selfish and thus lonely. This is why all Westerners suffer from loneliness. You just cannot complain about why you are so lonely after isolating yourselves from anyone whom you could socialize with. There are hundreds of cases in which people die alone in their homes without their death being discovered for years after they die. This is just insane. How could you be so OK about it all? It is high time you realised that this kind of hyper-individualistic mentality is getting out of control by having been exploited a lot for decades.

comment_content.original_script:
Waiting for the world to end, should never be about hiding out. It's about sharing the good news of Jesus Christ with others, so that they may be saved. I do believe we are in the end days, which is even more of a reason to share Jesus.

YOU ARE LOVED...
God loves you and desires for you to spend eternity with Him, however, SIN has seperated you from God and from entering Heaven (If you have ever lied, you have sinned, making you are a sinner). That is why God sent His Son Jesus Christ to save you, to rescue you from the punishment of sin, eternal Hell. You can not get to Heaven on your own accord... Your good deeds, being a good person, your church, your money... Can not save you... Only Jesus Christ can save you!!!

WHAT TO DO...
Go to Jesus Christ with a humble heart. Repent of your sins and put your trust in Jesus Christ as your Lord and Savior.

AN EXAMPLE PRAYER:
Jesus Christ, I come to you a sinner, I repent of all my sins and ask for your forgiveness. I believe you are the Son of God, that you went to the cross, died in my place, paying my sin debt and that you were buried & rose on the 3rd day to everlasting life. Jesus, right now, I choose to receive you as my Lord and my Savior, trusting in you alone for my salvation. I surrender my life to you and ask for your will to be done. I invite your Holy Spirit to come into my heart to make me more like you. Thank you for your forgiveness. Thank you for filling me with the Holy Spirit and for your gift of eternal life in Heaven. Amen!

NOW WHAT:
Being a Christian is all about relationship. You grow in your relationship with God as you spend time with Him, in your Bible, in prayer, in time of worship and praise. I suggest reading the gospel of John first, and then read the books that apostle Paul wrote, Romans through Philemon. Apostle Paul was chosen by God to reach the gentiles (all non Jews).

comment_content.original_script:
@Universum
I see your comment is 2 weeks old, so not sure why this story has come up on YouTube's front page for me today (?); but the BBC's YouTube channel is absolutely crap.

Technically, the BBC is (sort of) 'owned' by the British public/ government- although it's independent from the government. In the UK we have to pay a TV licence fee which (partially) funds the BBC. This applies whether you watch it on a tv or any other kind of device.

The licence fee lets you watch BBC iplayer, which is unavailable (legally) in other countries. So much of the content that is made for the British site isn't allowed to be shown internationally because it's the British people who pay the licence fee.

More recently, they've started trying to get onto YouTube, but it's with shitty clips like this and links to their actual news stories under the videos.

I personally think it's a massive failure; everything seems superficial and with very little detail included.

They'd be better using their international set-up, showing adverts (because of the licence fee, in the UK, there are no adverts on the BBC) before clips and using 'international audience news' which is different.

Or they could hire someone who could actually advise them in how to do this properly. The BBC used to be such a good source of news. These days it's pretty pathetic.
